Method Detail

rm

public GitRmResponse rm(java.io.File repository,
                        java.io.File path)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitRm
Remove files relative to the path within the repository.

Specified by:
rm in interface IGitRm
Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to run rm against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
path - A single file to remove. The specified path must be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

rm

public GitRmResponse rm(java.io.File repository,
                        java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitRm
Remove files relative to the path within the repository.

Specified by:
rm in interface IGitRm
Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to run rm against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
paths - A list of files to remove. The paths specified in this list must all be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-null and non-empty list is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

rm

public GitRmResponse rm(java.io.File repository,
                        GitRmOptions options,
                        java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitRm
Remove files relative to the path within the repository.

Specified by:
rm in interface IGitRm
Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to run rm against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
options - The options to run rm with. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
paths - A list of files or folders to remove. The paths specified in this list must all be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-null and non-empty list is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.
